group.name: install
group.phrase: Command line installation is not supported
Unable to create database %1$s, please confirm the database name within the includes/config.php file or ask your host to create a database

Database connection failed due to unexpected error:
  • (%1$s) %2$s
Please ensure that the database and server is correctly configured and try again

You have already installed vBulletin

Do you wish to upgrade?
The database has failed to connect because you do not have permission to connect to the server. Please confirm the values entered in the includes/config.php file

Successfully connected to the database.

Would you like to see options for clearing the existing contents of this database?

Successfully connected to the database.

You may have already installed vBulletin. Would you like to see options for clearing the existing contents of this database?

New installation can not continue as long as vBulletin tables are detected within your database.

Perhaps you meant to Upgrade instead?

The following is a list of all tables found in your database. Tables that are recognized as part of vBulletin have been selected for you. There may be other tables listed that were not recognized - these will be highlighted in the list.

All selected tables and their contents will be permanently and irreversibly deleted from the database when the Delete Selected Tables button is clicked.

vBulletin and vBulletin Solutions Inc. can accept no responsibility for any loss of data incurred as a result of deleting database tables.
BB Title Title of board. Appears in the title of every page.
Location of Core Directory URL to your core directory (with no final "/"). For example, http://www.example.com/forums/core
Webmaster email address Email address of the webmaster.

Cookie Path The path to which the cookie is saved. If you run more than one forum on the same domain, it will be necessary to set this to the individual directories of the forums. Otherwise, just leave it as / .

Suggested valid values for Cookie Path are available in the drop-down menu opposite. If you have a good reason to want a different setting, tick the checkbox and enter the desired value in the box provided. Please note that your path should always end in a forward-slash; for example '/forums/', '/vbulletin/' etc.

Entering an invalid setting can leave you unable to login to your forum.

Cookie Domain This option sets the domain on which the cookie is active. The most common reason to change this setting is that you have two different urls to your forum, i.e. example.com and forums.example.com. To allow users to stay logged into the forum if they visit via either url, you would set this to .example.com (note the domain begins with a dot).

Suggested valid values for Cookie Domain are available in the drop-down menu opposite. If you have a good reason to want a different setting, tick the checkbox and enter the desired value in the box provided.

You most likely want to leave this setting blank as entering an invalid setting can leave you unable to login to your forum.
Please fill in the form below to setup an administrator account
* The 'Password' and 'Confirm Password' fields do not match!
* Your password cannot be the same as your username

If this is your first visit, be sure to check out the FAQ by clicking the link above. You may have to register before you can post: click the register link above to proceed. To start viewing messages, select the forum that you want to visit from the selection below.

group.name: core
group.phrase:
Javascript support within your browser may be disabled; this is required to continue. If javascript is enabled, verify that this file is in place:

Upgrade Javascript
You not have 'ALTER' permission for this database. Please contact your host and request the 'ALTER' permission.
The 'clientscript/vbulletin_css' directory and/or its sub directories is/are not writable. Please make sure that this directory and its sub directories are writable by your web server.
VB_AREA or THIS_SCRIPT must be defined to continue
vBulletin 5 requires PHP version 5.3.0 or greater. Your PHP is version %1$s, please ask your host to upgrade.
vBulletin 5 requires MySQL version 5.1.5 or greater. Your MySQL is version %1$s, please ask your host to upgrade.
We were unable to locate the 'includes/config.php' file, please confirm that this file exists.
We were unable to read the 'includes/config.php' file, please check the permissions.

MySQL is running in strict mode. While you may proceed, some areas of vBulletin may not function properly. It is strongly recommended that you set $config['Database']['force_sql_mode'] to true in your includes/config.php file!
(Please be patient as some parts may take some time)
Skipping version number update, you already have a newer version...
Batch complete! Click the button on the right if you are not redirected automatically.
Click the button on the right to proceed.
THE FOLLOWING USER NAMES CONTAIN SEMI COLONS ( ; ) AND *MUST* BE CHANGED IN THE CONTROL PANEL:

From here, you can back up your vBulletin database.

Please note that if you have a particularly large database, this script may not be able to fully back it up.

For a foolproof backup, login to your server via Telnet or SSH and use the mysqldump command on the command line. For more details, http://www.vbulletin.com/manual/html/manual_database_backup.

Backups must be run prior to the upgrade, if the upgrade is complete please use the Admin Control Panel.

For a foolproof backup, login to your server via Telnet or SSH and use the mysqldump command on the command line. For more details, http://www.vbulletin.com/docs/html/maintenance_ssh_backup.
eAccelerator for PHP must be upgraded to 0.9.3 or newer.
Your server is running a version of the Alternative PHP Cache (APC) that is incompatible with vBulletin. Please upgrade APC to version 3.0.0 or newer.
Turck MMCache has been made obsolete by eAccelerator and does not function properly with vBulletin.
The includes/xml/bitfield_vbulletin.xml file is out of date. Please ensure you have uploaded the correct file.

The following tables that are new to this version of vBulletin are already in your database:

%1$s

This could be because:

  • A vBulletin modification has created a table of the same name
  • Another application has a table of the same name
  • You restored a database from an earlier version of vBulletin over a database that had already been upgraded.
  • You are intentionally running this step a second time.
Please contact support if you are unsure about continuing. If you wish you proceed with the upgrade click 'Okay'. The existing table(s) will not be modified.

The following table is new to this version of vBulletin but is already in your database: %1$s

This could be because:
* A vBulletin modification has created a table of the same name
* Another application has a table of the same name
* You restored a database from an earlier version of vBulletin over a database that had already been upgraded.
* You are intentionally running this step a second time.

Please contact support if you are unsure about continuing. If you wish you proceed with the upgrade enter '1'. The existing table(s) will not be modified.
The next step may take a long time, please be patient.
Your upgrade log shows that your last upgrade was to version %1$s but you are currently on version %2$s.

Your upgrade log shows that your next upgrade should be to version %1$s but you are currently on version %2$s.

If you would like to continue with the upgrade to %1$s, enter '1'. If you would like to go to the upgrade that follows %2$s, enter '2'.

An error has occurred with your database. Please contact vBulletin Support for assistance.

Module: %1$s, Step %2$s Database Error:%3$s

%4$s

Query:

%5$s

An error has occurred. Please contact vBulletin Support for assistance.

Module: %1$s, Step %2$s Error.

%3$s

Press the button below to begin the install of
vBulletin %1$s

Press the button below to begin the upgrade
from %1$s to %2$s
<font color="red">Upgrading to vBulletin %1$s will remove any currently installed products as they are not compatible with %2$s.</font>
Press the button below to run the Final Upgrade step

At present, your forum has more than %1$s posts. If you encounter timeouts during the install process, there is a console version of the upgrade available to you. In order to perform a console upgrade, perform the following steps:
  1. Login to your server via SSH
  2. Change your directory to the install directory of your forums, example:
    • cd /forums/install
  3. Execute the upgrade script, example:
    • php -f upgrade.php
Contact vBulletin Customer Support if you are still unsure of how to continue.
The server returned no response. This is probably due to a timeout setting. Please contact vBulletin Support for assistance
Turck MMCache has been detected on your server. Turck MMCache is not supported in recent versions of PHP and can cause problems with vBulletin. We recommend that it be disabled.
Due to the following errors, the install/upgrade can not continue:
Selected database type '%1$s' was not detected within your compilation of PHP
Creation of InnoDB Table '%1$s' failed. Contact support. Failure code 1005:121. Associated .frm file needs to be copied in to place and table properly deleted before table creation can continue.

Please note that the 'clientscript/vbulletin_css' directory and its sub directories need to be writable by your web server. If you did not execute this upgrade as the user under which your web server operates, there may have been files and folders written to 'clientscript/vbulletin_css' that are not writable. If you encounter error messages about not being able to write to the 'clientscript/vbulletin_css' directory within the admin cp, check that this directory and its sub directories allow your web server to write to them.
An unexpected error occured, the install/upgrade cannot continue.

group.name: 400a1
group.phrase: Moving picture %1$s into the Attachment System
Could not find file "%1$s" in filesystem

New post and thread indexes not added

Because of the size of post table adding the post and thread indexes could take considerable time, the upgrade script will not add them. Instead, a script has been provided to add these indexes seperately at /install/upgrade_400a1_indexes.php. Instructions for how to use the script can be found in that file.

While these indexes are not required to operate vBulletin, they should improve performance for large boards. Adding them is highly recommended.

group.name: 400rc2
group.phrase: Updating Custom Profile Field category location data.

Unused indexes not removed

Because of the size of your post table, several unusued indexes have not been removed during the upgrade because this could take considerable time. Instead, a script has been provided to remove these indexes seperately at /install/upgrade_404_indexes.php. Instructions for how to use the script can be found in that file.

While removal of these indexes are not required to operate vBulletin, removing them will increase performance.
